Text:
A simple loop around the objects would do.

    var t = storedetails.stores;
    function getProduct(storeName, pId){
	var p; 
	angular.forEach(t[storeName], function(product, index){ 
		console.log(product.pno, pId); 
		if(product.pno === pId) 
		{
			console.log("===========");
			p=product; 
		} 
	}) 
	return p;
    }

Now calling simply the function `getProduct("store1", 1)` would give the result of the product id 1 from the store1 object

A simple loop around the objects would do.

    var t = storedetails.stores;
    function getProduct(storeName, pId){
	var p; 
	angular.forEach(t[storeName], function(product, index){ 
		console.log(product.pno, pId); 
		if(product.pno === pId) 
		{
			console.log("===========");
			p=product; 
		} 
	}) 
	return p;
    }

Now calling simply the function `getProduct("store1", 1)` would give the result of the product id 1 from the store1 object

Update

    function getProduct(pId){
	var p; 
	angular.forEach(t, function(storeName, i){
		angular.forEach(storeName, function(product, index){ 
			if(product.pno === pId) 
			{
				p=product; 
			} 
		}) 
	})
	return p;
    }
